items.title: CCI, Deepak Fertilisers among 10 high-conviction stock ideas that can rally up to 67%
items.description: InCred Capital has highlighted ten high-conviction ideas in the midcap and smallcap space, with potential upsides of up to 67%. The brokerage sees strong growth triggers across logistics, pharma, fertilisers, specialty chemicals, retail, packaging, and spirits, backed by sectoral demand and structural tailwinds. Here are the 10 stocks that InCred believes can deliver outsized returns.

items.title: Mcap of five of 10 most valued firms climbs Rs 60,675.94 cr; SBI, HDFC Bank biggest winners
items.description: The market capitalization of five of the top ten firms increased last week. State Bank of India and HDFC Bank were the top gainers. Reliance Industries retained its position as the most valued firm. However, LIC, Bajaj Finance, ICICI Bank, TCS and Hindustan Unilever experienced a decline in market capitalization.

items.title: FPIs dump Indian equities worth Rs 21,000 cr in first half of Aug
items.description: Foreign investors offloaded nearly Rs 21,000 crore in Indian equities in the first half of August, bringing the year's total outflow to Rs 1.16 lakh crore. Trade tensions, weak earnings, and a weakening rupee contributed to this trend. However, a potential credit rating upgrade and easing US-Russia tensions could improve FPI sentiment.

items.title: China’s $11 trillion stock market is a headache for both Xi and Trump
items.description: At the heart of why consumers in China save so much and spend so little, and why Xi Jinping and Donald Trump will struggle to change that behavior even if they want to, lies the country’s stock market.

items.title: Market Trading Guide: Manappuram Finance and 1 midcap are stocks to buy on Monday. Up to 6% upside seen in near term
items.description: India’s headline indices ended flat on Thursday amid selling pressure in auto, FMCG and metal stocks, though bank and IT counters put up a fight. Nifty witnessed a lackluster trading session, remaining range-bound ahead of the Trump–Putin meeting on Friday.Commenting on the day’s action, Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst at LKP Securities, said that the overall sentiment is likely to favour bullish trades as long as the index holds above 24,337. “On the higher side, resistance is placed at 24,660 and 24,850, while a fall below 24,337 could trigger a resumption of the bearish trend,” De noted.Here are the 2 stock recommendations for Monday:

items.title: RIL, Paytm among 5 stocks to buy this week with up to 56% upside potential. Check why
items.description: With a slew of positive triggers like PM Narendra Modi's announcement of GST reforms in the Independence Day speech and Trump-Putin's arriving at an "understanding" on the Russia-Ukraine war issue, markets are expected to trade positively this week, says Anuj Gupta, Director at Ya Wealth Global Research. Nifty also ended its 6-week's losing streak, says Gupta, who recommends 5 stocks to buy this week to capitalise on the current market momentum:

items.title: These 10 Penny stocks surged up to 80% in just a month, do you own any?
Trump-Putin talk, GST reform and FII action among 9 factors to impact stock markets this week
items.description: Indian benchmark indices finally ended their six-week losing spree to end 1% higher every week. A host of important domestic and global events scheduled for the week are likely to impact stock markets when they resume trading on Monday.
